A **convict** is a [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") added in the [Convict patch](/wiki/Convict "Convict"), corresponding to the Convict [role](/wiki/Role "Role"). Like other player monsters, convicts are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. No convicts are normally found outside the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), where they may appear among the hostile player monsters generated there[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

Reading a cursed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") as a Convict while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") will summon a number of convict monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using [undead turning](/wiki/Undead_turning "Undead turning") on the corpse or [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on the statue of a dead convict left on a [bones level](/wiki/Bones_level "Bones level") will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. Convict corpses will also be found in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead")[\[2\]](#cite_note-2), and a statue of a convict may appear on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island")[\[3\]](#cite_note-3).

Most convicts encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), which may temporarily assume the form of a convict.

## Equipment[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

A convict on the Astral Plane will carry either a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") (50%) or a randomly chosen [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon (50%). The [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")'s [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") or [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") of the same type, if possible.

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, convicts will also be equipped with [1d3](/wiki/D_notation "D notation") random [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), 1d3 random [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item") and 1d3 random [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), as well as a randomly generated [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") containing [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") and various other pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") (as well as a [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor"), some [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and other items).

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the convict's preferred weapon is a [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail") (75%), versus a long sword (12.5%) or other weapon (12.5%). In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), it is always a [heavy iron ball](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball").

A convict:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A convict is a player monster added in the Convict patch, corresponding to the Convict role. Like other player monsters, convicts are never randomly generated and are thus rarely seen. No convicts are normally found outside the Astral Plane, where they may appear among the hostile player monsters generated there[1].

Reading a cursed scroll of genocide as a Convict while confused will summon a number of convict monsters, although they won't have their usual equipment. Using undead turning on the corpse or stone to flesh on the statue of a dead convict left on a bones level will revive the corpse or statue as a player monster. Convict corpses will also be found in the Valley of the Dead[2], and a statue of a convict may appear on Medusa's Island[3].

Most convicts encountered in the main dungeon will turn out to be doppelgangers, which may temporarily assume the form of a convict.

Equipment[4]

A convict on the Astral Plane will carry either a long sword (50%) or a randomly chosen melee weapon (50%). The weapon's enchantment will be random between +4 and +8, and it will be either erodeproof or greased (but not both) with 33.3% probability each. There is a 50% chance that the weapon will be made into an artifact of the same type, if possible.

Like other player monsters on the Astral Plane, convicts will also be equipped with 1d3 random offensive items, 1d3 random defensive items and 1d3 random miscellaneous items, as well as a randomly generated ascension kit containing dragon scale mail and various other pieces of armor (as well as a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor, some gold and other items).

In dNetHack, the convict's preferred weapon is a flail (75%), versus a long sword (12.5%) or other weapon (12.5%). In SlashTHEM, it is always a heavy iron ball.
